content:
Yes, food is an essential part of the festivities during the Gaddi festival. Traditional dishes and drinks are prepared and shared among the community. Some of the popular dishes that you may find during the festival include:

1. Sidu – It is a steamed bread made from wheat flour, yeast, and salt that is commonly served with ghee or butter and a side of dal.

2. Dhaam – It is a platter of dishes that includes rice, dal, rajma, kadhi, and curd. It is usually served on a leaf plate called "pattal."

3. Babru – It is a deep-fried pastry made from wheat flour, black gram, and spices. It is served with tamarind chutney or yogurt.

4. Aktori – It is a pancake-like dish made with buckwheat flour and served with ghee, butter, and a side of dal.

5. Chaa Ghosht – It is a meat dish made with lamb or mutton, green tea leaves, and spices.

6. Madra – It is a creamy curry made with chickpeas, nuts, and spices.

These are just a few examples of the dishes that you may find during the Gaddi festival. The food represents the local Himachali flavors and is an excellent way to experience the culture of the region.
